articles.title: –ö–∞–∫ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å ¬´–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é¬ª –Ω–∞ –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–º

import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

–í–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π ‚Äî —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —è–∑—ã–∫, –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∏–π –Ω–∏ –Ω–∞ –æ–¥–∏–Ω –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π –≤ –ï–≤—Ä–æ–ø–µ. –ü—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ –ª—é–±–≤–∏ –∑–≤—É—á–∞—Ç –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –º–µ–ª–æ–¥–∏—á–Ω–æ!

## –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—ã —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å ¬´–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é¬ª

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Szeretlek"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é"
  pronunciation="—Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫"
  context="–°–∞–º–æ–µ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ"
/>

### –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω–∞—è —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∞

/>

| –í–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ |
|------------|--------------|---------|
| **Szeretlek** | —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫ | –Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é |
| **Nagyon szeretlek** | –Ω–∞–¥—ë–Ω —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫ | –Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ª—é–±–ª—é |
| **Im√°dlak** | –∏–º–∞–¥–ª–∞–∫ | –Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –æ–±–æ–∂–∞—é |

<CultureTip title="–£–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞" flag="üá≠üá∫">
–í –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–º ¬´szeretlek¬ª ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ! –û–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏–µ ¬´-lek¬ª —É–∂–µ –æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–∞–µ—Ç ¬´—è —Ç–µ–±—è¬ª. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å ¬´—è¬ª –∏ ¬´—Ç–µ–±—è¬ª –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ.
</CultureTip>

## –í–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è

### –ü–æ —Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–∏ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤

  word="Nagyon-nagyon szeretlek"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –æ—á–µ–Ω—å-–æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ª—é–±–ª—é"

  example="Tudod mit? Nagyon-nagyon szeretlek!"
/>

| –í–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ |
|------------|--------------|---------|
| **Szeretlek t√©ged** | —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫ —Ç—ç–≥–µ–¥ | –Ø –ª—é–±–ª—é –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Ç–µ–±—è |
| **√ñr√∂kk√© szeretlek** | √∂r√∂kk√© —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫ | –õ—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±—è –≤–µ—á–Ω–æ |
| **Szeretlek az √©gig** | —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫ –∞–∑ —ç–≥–∏–≥ | –õ—é–±–ª—é –¥–æ –Ω–µ–±–µ—Å |
| **Te vagy mindenem** | —Ç—ç –≤–∞–¥—å –º–∏–Ω–¥—ç–Ω—ç–º | –¢—ã ‚Äî –º–æ—ë –≤—Å—ë |

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã

<VocabCard
  word="Te vagy az √©letem szerelme"
  translation="–¢—ã –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å –º–æ–µ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏"
  pronunciation="—Ç—ç –≤–∞–¥—å –∞–∑ —ç–ª—ç—Ç—ç–º —Å—ç—Ä—ç–ª–º—ç"
  example="Tudtam az els≈ë pillanatt√≥l, hogy te vagy az √©letem szerelme."
/>

### –ü—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è

- **"Bel√©dszerettem"** [–±—ç–ª–µ–¥—Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç—Ç—ç–º] ‚Äî –Ø –≤ —Ç–µ–±—è –≤–ª—é–±–∏–ª—Å—è/–ª–∞—Å—å
- **"Nem tudok n√©lk√ºled √©lni"** [–Ω—ç–º —Ç—É–¥–æ–∫ –Ω—ç–ª–∫—é–ª–µ–¥ —ç–ª–Ω–∏] ‚Äî –ù–µ –º–æ–≥—É –±–µ–∑ —Ç–µ–±—è –∂–∏—Ç—å
- **"Te vagy nekem minden"** [—Ç—ç –≤–∞–¥—å –Ω—ç–∫—ç–º –º–∏–Ω–¥—ç–Ω] ‚Äî –¢—ã –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è –≤—Å—ë
- **"Egym√°snak lett√ºnk teremtve"** [—ç–¥—å–º–∞—à–Ω–∞–∫ –ª–µ—Ç—Ç—é–Ω–∫ —Ç—ç—Ä—ç–º—Ç–≤—ç] ‚Äî –ú—ã —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω—ã –¥—Ä—É–≥ –¥–ª—è –¥—Ä—É–≥–∞

## –õ–∞—Å–∫–æ–≤—ã–µ –æ–±—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏—è

  word="Dr√°g√°m"

/>

|------------|--------------|---------|
| **Dr√°g√°m** | –¥—Ä–∞–≥–∞–º | –î–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–π/–∞—è |
| **Szerelmem** | —Å—ç—Ä—ç–ª–º—ç–º | –õ—é–±–æ–≤—å –º–æ—è |
| **Kincsem** | –∫–∏–Ω—á—ç–º | –°–æ–∫—Ä–æ–≤–∏—â–µ –º–æ—ë |
| **√âdesem** | —ç–¥—ç—à—ç–º | –°–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏–π/–∞—è –º–æ–π/–º–æ—è |
| **Sz√≠vem** | —Å–∏–≤—ç–º | –°–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–µ –º–æ—ë |

<CultureTip title="–ü—Ä–∏—Ç—è–∂–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Å—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å—ã" flag="üá≠üá∫">
–í –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–º ¬´–º–æ—ë¬ª –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å–æ–º ¬´-m¬ª –∏–ª–∏ ¬´-em¬ª: sz√≠v (—Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–µ) ‚Üí sz√≠vem (–º–æ—ë —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–µ), kincs (—Å–æ–∫—Ä–æ–≤–∏—â–µ) ‚Üí kincsem (–º–æ—ë —Å–æ–∫—Ä–æ–≤–∏—â–µ).
</CultureTip>

## –í –æ—Å–æ–±—ã—Ö –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ö

### –ü—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä—É–∫–∏ –∏ —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–∞

<VocabCard
  word="Hozz√°m j√∂ssz feles√©g√ºl?"
  translation="–í—ã–π–¥–µ—à—å –∑–∞ –º–µ–Ω—è –∑–∞–º—É–∂?"
  pronunciation="—Ö–æ–∑–∑–∞–º –π√∂—Å—Å —Ñ—ç–ª—ç—à—ç–≥—é–ª—å"
  example="Szeretlek. Hozz√°m j√∂ssz feles√©g√ºl?"
/>

### –ù–∞ —Å–≤–∞–¥—å–±–µ

- **"Igen"** [–∏–≥—ç–Ω] ‚Äî –î–∞
- **"√çg√©rem"** [–∏–≥—ç—Ä—ç–º] ‚Äî –û–±–µ—â–∞—é
- **"√ñr√∂kk√© a ti√©d"** [√∂r√∂kk√© –∞ —Ç–∏—ç–¥] ‚Äî –ù–∞–≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ —Ç–≤–æ–π/—Ç–≤–æ—è

## –ï–∂–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è

<VocabCard
  word="Tudod, hogy szeretlek?"
  translation="–ó–Ω–∞–µ—à—å, —á—Ç–æ —è —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é?"
  pronunciation="—Ç—É–¥–æ–¥, —Ö–æ—Ç—å —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫"
  example="H√©, tudod, hogy nagyon szeretlek?"
/>

| –°–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏—è | –í–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π | –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ |
|----------|------------|---------|
| –£—Ç—Ä–æ–º | **J√≥ reggelt, szerelmem** | –î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ, –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å –º–æ—è |
| –ü–µ—Ä–µ–¥ —Å–Ω–æ–º | **J√≥ √©jt, szeretlek** | –°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏, –ª—é–±–ª—é |
| –ü—Ä–∏ —Ä–∞—Å—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ | **Hi√°nyozni fogsz** | –ë—É–¥—É —Å–∫—É—á–∞—Ç—å |
| –í —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏ | **Puszi** | –¶–µ–ª—É—é |

## –û—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ

<VocabCard
  word="√ân is szeretlek"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è —Ç–æ–∂–µ –ª—é–±–ª—é"
  pronunciation="—ç–Ω –∏—à —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫"
  example="‚Äî Szeretlek! ‚Äî √ân is szeretlek, dr√°g√°m."
/>

| –í–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ |
|------------|--------------|---------|
| **√ân is szeretlek** | —ç–Ω –∏—à —Å—ç—Ä—ç—Ç–ª–µ–∫ | –Ø —Ç–µ–±—è —Ç–æ–∂–µ –ª—é–±–ª—é |
| **√ân is** | —ç–Ω –∏—à | –Ø —Ç–æ–∂–µ |
| **Mind√∂r√∂kk√©** | –º–∏–Ω–¥√∂r√∂–∫–∫—ç | –ù–∞–≤–µ—á–Ω–æ |

Szeress √©s l√©gy szeretve! (–õ—é–±–∏ –∏ –±—É–¥—å –ª—é–±–∏–º!)

## –ü—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∏—Ç—å –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ

- **[–†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã](/learn/ru/hu/hungarian-romantic-phrases-every-occasion/)** - –ù–∞ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π —Å–ª—É—á–∞–π
- **[–õ–∞—Å–∫–æ–≤—ã–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏—â–∞](/learn/ru/hu/hungarian-pet-names-terms-of-endearment/)** - –ù–µ–∂–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞
- **[–°–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ä—å –¥–ª—è —Å–≤–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è](/learn/ru/hu/hungarian-date-night-vocabulary/)** - –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä
- **[–ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ](/learn/ru/hu/hungarian-pronunciation-guide/)** - –û—Å–≤–æ–π—Ç–µ –∑–≤—É–∫–∏

articles.title: Passato Portoghese: Pret√©rito vs Imperfeito
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Passato Portoghese: Pret√©rito vs Imperfeito

Come in italiano, il portoghese ha due tempi passati principali. La buona notizia? Funzionano quasi esattamente come il passato remoto/prossimo √® l'imperfetto italiani!

## La Frase del Giorno

<PhraseOfDay
  verb="Quando te conheci, me apaixonei"
  meaning="Quando ti ho conosciuto, mi sono innamorato"
  pronunciation="KWAN-do te ko-nye-SI, me a-pai-sho-NEI"
  context="Entrambi i verbi sono nel pret√©rito perfeito - azioni concluse"
/>

## Pret√©rito Perfeito (Azione Conclusa)

Il pret√©rito perfeito descrive azioni completate nel passato, come il passato prossimo/remoto italiano.

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Amar (Pret√©rito)"
  meaning="Amare (Passato)"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Eu", word: "amei" },
    { person: "Tu", word: "amaste" },
    { person: "Ele/Ela/Voc√™", word: "amou" },
    { person: "N√≥s", word: "amamos" },
    { person: "V√≥s", word: "amastes" },
    { person: "Eles/Voc√™s", word: "amaram" }
  ]}
/>

<VocabCard
  verb="Eu te amei desde o primeiro dia"
  meaning="Ti ho amato dal primo giorno"
  pronunciation="eu te a-MEI DES-de o pri-MEI-ro DI-a"
  example="Eu te amei desde o primeiro dia que te vi"
/>

<VocabCard
  verb="Ontem fomos ao cinema"
  meaning="Ieri siamo andati al cinema"
  pronunciation="ON-tem FO-mos ao si-NE-ma"
  example="Ontem fomos ao cinema ver um filme rom√¢ntico"
/>

## Pret√©rito Imperfeito (Azione Continua/Abituale)

L'imperfeito descrive azioni abituali o in corso nel passato, esattamente come in italiano!

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Amar (Imperfeito)"
  meaning="Amare (Imperfetto)"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Eu", word: "amava" },
    { person: "Tu", word: "amavas" },
    { person: "Ele/Ela/Voc√™", word: "amava" },
    { person: "N√≥s", word: "am√°vamos" },
    { person: "V√≥s", word: "am√°veis" },
    { person: "Eles/Voc√™s", word: "amavam" }
  ]}
/>

<CultureTip
  title="Confronto Diretto"
  flag="üáÆüáπüáµüáπ"
>
Italiano: amavo, amavi, amava, amavamo, amavate, amavano.
Portoghese: amava, amavas, amava, am√°vamos, am√°veis, amavam.
Le forme sono quasi identiche! Il portoghese √® davvero una lingua sorella.
</CultureTip>

<VocabCard
  verb="Quando era jovem, sonhava contigo"
  meaning="Quando ero giovane, sognavo con te"
  pronunciation="KWAN-do E-ra JO-vem, so-NYA-va kon-TI-go"
  example="Quando era jovem, sempre sonhava contigo"
/>

<VocabCard
  verb="N√≥s nos v√≠amos todos os dias"
  meaning="Ci vedevamo tutti i giorni"
  pronunciation="n√≥s nos VI-a-mos TO-dos os DI-as"
  example="N√≥s nos v√≠amos todos os dias na universidade"
/>

## Quando Usare Quale Tempo

### Usa il Pret√©rito Perfeito per:
- Azioni concluse: "Ontem liguei para voc√™" (Ieri ti ho chiamato)
- Sequenze di eventi: "Acordei, tomei caf√© e sa√≠" (Mi sono svegliato, ho preso il caff√® e sono uscito)
- Momenti specifici: "Nos conhecemos em 2020" (Ci siamo conosciuti nel 2020)

### Usa l'Imperfeito per:
- Azioni abituali: "Sempre te ligava de manh√£" (Ti chiamavo sempre di mattina)
- Descrizioni nel passato: "Ela era linda" (Lei era bella)
- Azioni in corso: "Enquanto dormia, voc√™ chegou" (Mentre dormivo, sei arrivato)

## Verbi Irregolari Importanti

### Ser (Pret√©rito vs Imperfeito)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Ser (Pret√©rito)"
  meaning="Essere (Passato)"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Eu", word: "fui" },
    { person: "Tu", word: "foste" },
    { person: "Ele/Ela/Voc√™", word: "foi" },
    { person: "N√≥s", word: "fomos" },
    { person: "Eles/Voc√™s", word: "foram" }
  ]}
/>

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Ser (Imperfeito)"
  meaning="Essere (Imperfetto)"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Eu", word: "era" },
    { person: "Tu", word: "eras" },
    { person: "Ele/Ela/Voc√™", word: "era" },
    { person: "N√≥s", word: "√©ramos" },
    { person: "Eles/Voc√™s", word: "eram" }
  ]}
/>

## Esempi Romantici

<VocabCard
  verb="Quando te vi, soube que era voc√™"
  meaning="Quando ti ho visto, ho saputo che eri tu"
  pronunciation="KWAN-do te VI, SOU-be ke E-ra vo-S√ä"
  example="Quando te vi pela primeira vez, soube que era voc√™"
/>

<VocabCard
  verb="Enquanto esperava, pensava em voc√™"
  meaning="Mentre aspettavo, pensavo a te"
  pronunciation="en-KWAN-to es-pe-RA-va, pen-SA-va em vo-S√ä"
  example="Enquanto esperava o √¥nibus, pensava em voc√™"
/>

<CTA
  text="Pratica i tempi passati con storie romantiche interattive!"
  buttonText="Inizia a Praticare"
/>

articles.title: Godmorgen og Godnat p√• Portugisisk: S√∏de Fraser til Din Partner
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

De f√∏rste og sidste ord p√• dagen er magiske. En s√∏d godmorgen p√• portugisisk kan starte dagen perfekt, og en k√¶rlig godnat sikrer s√∏de dr√∏mme. Kombiner med vores [portugisiske k√¶lenavne](/learn/da/pt/portuguese-pet-names-and-endearments/)!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Good morning, my love"
  translation="Godmorgen, min elskede"
  pronunciation="gud mor-ning mai lav"
  context="Start dagen med k√¶rlighed"
/>

## Godmorgen Fraser

<VocabCard
  word="Good morning"
  translation="Godmorgen"
  pronunciation="gud mor-ning"
  example="Good morning, sweetheart!"
/>

| Portugisisk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **Good morning** | Godmorgen | gud mor-ning |
| **Good morning, my love** | Godmorgen, min elskede | gud mor-ning mai lav |
| **Did you sleep well?** | Har du sovet godt? | did juu sliip wel? |
| **What a beautiful morning** | Sikke en smuk morgen | wot uh byu-ti-ful mor-ning |
| **Rise and shine!** | Op og hoppe! | raiz and shain! |

### S√∏de Morgenhilsner

- **Did you dream of me?** (Har du dr√∏mt om mig?) - "did juu driim ov mi?"
- **You're my first thought** (Du er min f√∏rste tanke) - "joor mai furst thot"
- **Coffee, darling?** (Kaffe, skat?) - "ko-fi, dar-ling?"

<CultureTip flag="üáßüá∑" title="Morgenkultur">
Engl√¶ndere starter ofte dagen med 'a cuppa' - perfekt tidspunkt for en k√¶rlig besked.
</CultureTip>

## Morgenmotivation

- **Have a good day** (Hav en god dag) - "hav uh gud dei"
- **You'll do great** (Du vil klare det fantastisk) - "juul duu greit"
- **I'm proud of you** (Jeg er stolt af dig) - "aim praud ov juu"
- **Good luck today** (Held og lykke i dag) - "gud lak tuh-dei"

## I L√∏bet af Dagen

<VocabCard
  word="Thinking of you"
  translation="Jeg t√¶nker p√• dig"
  pronunciation="thing-king ov juu"
  example="Just thinking of you."
/>

| Portugisisk | Dansk | Hvorn√•r |
|---------|-------|---------|
| **Thinking of you** | Jeg t√¶nker p√• dig | Midt p√• dagen |
| **I miss you** | Jeg savner dig | N√•r adskilt |
| **How's your day going?** | Hvordan g√•r din dag? | Eftermiddag |
| **See you soon** | Vi ses snart | F√∏r genforening |

## Godaften Fraser

- **Good evening** (Godaften) - "gud iiv-ning"
- **Finally home** (Endelig hjemme) - "fai-na-li houm"
- **I missed you** (Jeg har savnet dig) - "ai mist juu"
- **How was your day?** (Hvordan var din dag?) - "hau woz joor dei?"

## Godnat Fraser

<VocabCard
  word="Good night"
  translation="Godnat"
  pronunciation="gud nait"
  example="Good night, sleep tight."
/>

| Portugisisk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **Good night** | Godnat | gud nait |
| **Good night, my love** | Godnat, min elskede | gud nait mai lav |
| **Sweet dreams** | S√∏de dr√∏mme | swiit driimz |
| **Sleep tight** | Sov godt | sliip tait |
| **See you tomorrow** | Vi ses i morgen | sii juu tuh-mo-rou |

### Romantiske Godnat-beskeder

- **You're my last thought** (Du er min sidste tanke) - "joor mai last thot"
- **Dream of me** (Dr√∏m om mig) - "driim ov mi"
- **A goodnight kiss** (Et godnat-kys) - "uh gud-nait kis"
- **I love you, goodnight** (Jeg elsker dig, godnat) - "ai lav juu gud-nait"

<CultureTip flag="üáßüá∑" title="Godnat-traditioner">
Et godnat-kys og 'I love you' er den perfekte afslutning p√• dagen.
</CultureTip>

## S√∏vnrelaterede Fraser

| Portugisisk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **I'm tired** | Jeg er tr√¶t | aim tai-urd |
| **I'm sleepy** | Jeg er s√∏vnig | aim slii-pi |
| **I can't sleep** | Jeg kan ikke sove | ai kant sliip |
| **I had a nightmare** | Jeg havde mareridt | ai had uh nait-mehr |
| **Let's take a nap** | Lad os tage en lur | lets teik uh nap |

## Weekend Morgen

- **Let's stay in bed** (Lad os blive i sengen) - "lets stei in bed"
- **A lazy morning** (En doven morgen) - "uh lei-zi mor-ning"
- **Shall we brunch?** (Skal vi brunche?) - "shal wii brunch?"
- **Come cuddle** (Kom og kram) - "kum ku-dul"

## Tekstbeskeder

### Morgenbeskeder
- **Good morning, sweetheart üíï** (Godmorgen, skat üíï)
- **Hope you have an amazing day** (H√•ber du har en fantastisk dag)
- **Thinking of you** (T√¶nker p√• dig)

### Aftenbeskeder
- **Looking forward to seeing you** (Gl√¶der mig til at se dig)
- **Almost home** (Snart hjemme)
- **Goodnight, sweet dreams üåô** (Godnat, dr√∏m s√∏dt üåô)

## Tips til Daglige Ritualer

1. **V√¶r konsekvent** - G√∏r det til en vane
2. **Varier fraserne** - Brug forskellige hver dag
3. **Tilf√∏j k√¶lenavne** - Det g√∏r det personligt
4. **Send beskeder** - N√•r I er adskilt
5. **V√¶r oprigtig** - Sig det med f√∏lelse

For flere romantiske fraser, se [portugisiske romantiske fraser](/learn/da/pt/portuguese-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

Disse daglige portugisiske ritualer er sm√• k√¶rlighedserkl√¶ringer.

articles.title: Wymowa hiszpa≈Ñska dla poczƒÖtkujƒÖcych: Jak m√≥wiƒá romantycznie bez akcentu
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Czy zdarzy≈Ço Wam siƒô, ≈ºe chcia≈Çe≈õ powiedzieƒá co≈õ romantycznego po hiszpa≈Ñsku, ale zabrzmia≈Çe≈õ jak... robot? üòÖ Mi≈Ço≈õƒá nie zna barier jƒôzykowych, ale wymowa mo≈ºe byƒá wyzwaniem! DobrƒÖ wiadomo≈õciƒÖ jest to, ≈ºe hiszpa≈Ñska wymowa jest znacznie ≈Çatwiejsza ni≈º polska - ma tylko 5 samog≈Çosek i bardzo regularne zasady. Dzisiaj nauczycie siƒô razem, jak m√≥wiƒá po hiszpa≈Ñsku tak piƒôknie, jak brzmi Wasza mi≈Ço≈õƒá.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Te amo"
  translation="Kocham ciƒô"
  pronunciation="teh AH-moh"
  context="Najpiƒôkniejsze s≈Çowa w hiszpa≈Ñskim - powiedz je z ca≈Çego serca!"
/>

## Hiszpa≈Ñskie Samog≈Çoski: Sekret Romantycznego Brzmienia

Hiszpa≈Ñskie samog≈Çoski sƒÖ czyste i dzia≈ÇajƒÖ jak magia - zawsze wymawia siƒô je tak samo! To w≈Ça≈õnie one nadajƒÖ jƒôzykowi tego romantycznego brzmienia.

### 5 Podstawowych Samog≈Çosek

| Litera | Wymowa | Przyk≈Çad | Polski odpowiednik |
|--------|---------|----------|-------------------|
| **A** | "ah" | **casa** (KAH-sah) | jak 'a' w "mama" |
| **E** | "eh" | **te** (teh) | jak 'e' w "sen" |
| **I** | "ee" | **mi** (mee) | jak 'i' w "film" |
| **O** | "oh" | **te amo** (teh AH-moh) | jak 'o' w "okno" |
| **U** | "oo" | **t√∫** (too) | jak 'u' w "but" |

<VocabCard
  word="Hermosa"
  translation="Piƒôkna"
  pronunciation="ehr-MOH-sah"
  example="Eres hermosa esta noche."
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá™üá∏" title="Miƒôkkie hiszpa≈Ñskie r">
W hiszpa≈Ñskim istnieje miƒôkkie "r" (pojedyncze) i mocne "rr" (podw√≥jne). Single 'r' wymawia siƒô jak polskie 'r' w "para", podw√≥jne 'rr' to charakterystyczne hiszpa≈Ñskie "trrr" - jakby≈õ m√≥wi≈Ç "trz" bardzo szybko!
</CultureTip>

## Hiszpa≈Ñskie Sp√≥≈Çg≈Çoski: Wymowa, Kt√≥rƒÖ Pokochasz

Niekt√≥re hiszpa≈Ñskie sp√≥≈Çg≈Çoski mogƒÖ byƒá zaskakujƒÖce, ale sƒÖ prostsze ni≈º my≈õlisz!

### Najwa≈ºniejsze R√≥≈ºnice

**H** - Zawsze nieme! **Hola** brzmi "OH-lah"
**J** - Jak polskie "ch" w "chleb" - **jam√≥n** (hah-MOHN)
**LL** - Jak polskie "j" - **llamo** (YAH-moh)
**√ë** - Jak "≈Ñ" w "ko≈Ñ" - **ni√±o** (NEE-nyoh)
**V** - Jak "b" - **vivo** (BEE-boh)
**Z** - Jak polskie "s" - **zapato** (sah-PAH-toh)

## Romantyczne S≈Çowa Do Praktyki

Spr√≥bujcie razem wym√≥wiƒá te s≈Çodkie s≈Çowa:

| Hiszpa≈Ñski | Polski | Wymowa | U≈ºycie |
|------------|---------|---------|---------|
| **Cari√±o** | Kochanie | kah-REE-nyoh | [Czu≈Çe wyrazy](/learn/pl/es/spanish-pet-names-for-your-partner/) |
| **Amor** | Mi≈Ço≈õƒá | ah-MOHR | Og√≥lne okre≈õlenie mi≈Ço≈õci |
| **Coraz√≥n** | Serce | koh-rah-SOHN | "Moje serce" |
| **Vida** | ≈ªycie | BEE-dah | "Moje ≈ºycie" |
| **Cielo** | Niebo | see-EH-loh | "Moje niebo" |

<VocabCard
  word="Preciosa"
  translation="Cudowna"
  pronunciation="preh-see-OH-sah"
  example="Mi preciosa, ¬øc√≥mo est√°s?"
/>

## Akcent i Intonacja: Klucz do Romantycznego Brzmienia

Hiszpa≈Ñski ma melodyjnƒÖ intonacjƒô - spada na ko≈Ñcu zdania w pytaniach i wznosi w pytaniach! To sprawia, ≈ºe nawet proste s≈Çowa brzmiƒÖ romantycznie.

### Zasady Akcentu

1. **S≈Çowa ko≈ÑczƒÖce siƒô na samog≈Çoskƒô** - akcent na przedostatniƒÖ sylabƒô
   - **Casa** (KAH-sah) - dom
   - **Hermosa** (ehr-MOH-sah) - piƒôkna

2. **S≈Çowa ko≈ÑczƒÖce siƒô na sp√≥≈Çg≈Çoskƒô** - akcent na ostatniƒÖ sylabƒô
   - **Coraz√≥n** (koh-rah-SOHN) - serce
   - **Espa√±ol** (ehs-pah-NYOHL) - hiszpa≈Ñski

3. **S≈Çowa z akcentem pisemnym** - zawsze akcentujƒÖ oznaczonƒÖ sylabƒô
   - **Tel√©fono** (teh-LEH-foh-noh) - telefon
   - **Am√©ricano** (ah-meh-ree-KAH-noh) - ameryka≈Ñski

<CultureTip flag="üá™üá∏" title="Emocje w wymowie">
Hiszpa≈Ñczycy sƒÖ bardzo ekspresyjni! Nie b√≥j siƒô wyra≈ºaƒá emocji w g≈Çosie - im wiƒôcej serca w wymowie, tym bardziej autentycznie zabrzmi. Twoja mi≈Ço≈õƒá do partnera pomo≈ºe Ci zabrzmieƒá naturalnie!
</CultureTip>

## ƒÜwiczenia dla Par: Praktyka Czyni Mistrza

ƒÜwiczcie razem te romantyczne zwroty:

1. **"Buenos d√≠as, mi amor"** (BWEH-nohs DEE-ahs mee ah-MOHR) - Dzie≈Ñ dobry, moja mi≈Ço≈õci
2. **"¬øC√≥mo est√°s, hermosa?"** (KOH-moh ehs-TAHS ehr-MOH-sah?) - Jak siƒô masz, piƒôkna?
3. **"Te extra√±o"** (teh ehs-TRAH-nyoh) - Tƒôskniƒô za tobƒÖ
4. **"Eres mi todo"** (EH-rehs mee TOH-doh) - Jeste≈õ moim wszystkim
5. **"Mi coraz√≥n late por ti"** (mee koh-rah-SOHN LAH-teh pohr tee) - Moje serce bije dla ciebie

## Najczƒôstsze B≈Çƒôdy Polak√≥w

### 1. Polskie "r" zamiast hiszpa≈Ñskiego
**‚ùå B≈ÇƒÖd:** Wymawianie "pero" jak polskie "pero"
**‚úÖ Poprawnie:** "PEH-roh" (z hiszpa≈Ñskim "r")

### 2. Angielskie "th" zamiast hiszpa≈Ñskiego "z"
**‚ùå B≈ÇƒÖd:** "grathias" (angielskie th)
**‚úÖ Poprawnie:** "GRAH-see-ahs" (hiszpa≈Ñskie "s")

### 3. Polskie "cz" zamiast hiszpa≈Ñskiego "ch"
**‚ùå B≈ÇƒÖd:** "cz" w "mucho"
**‚úÖ Poprawnie:** "MOH-choh" (hiszpa≈Ñskie "ch" jak w "chleb")

## Szybka ≈öciƒÖgawka: Hiszpa≈Ñska Wymowa

Zapisz to sobie - idealne do powieszenia na lod√≥wce!

```
SAMOG≈ÅOSKI:
A = "ah"    E = "eh"    I = "ee"
O = "oh"    U = "oo"

SPECIALNE:
H = nieme   J = "ch"    LL = "j"
√ë = "≈Ñ"     V = "b"     Z = "s"

AKCENT:
Na przedostatniƒÖ (je≈õli ko≈Ñczy na samog≈Çoskƒô)
Na ostatniƒÖ (je≈õli ko≈Ñczy na sp√≥≈Çg≈Çoskƒô)
```

## Co Dalej?

Gratulacje! Z marszu opanowali≈õcie podstawy hiszpa≈Ñskiej wymowy. Teraz czas na praktykƒô! Spr√≥bujcie [romantycznych zwrot√≥w na ka≈ºdƒÖ okazjƒô](/learn/pl/es/romantic-spanish-phrases-for-every-occasion/) albo nauczcie siƒô [hiszpa≈Ñskich s≈Ç√≥wek na randkƒô](/learn/pl/es/spanish-date-night-vocabulary/). Pamiƒôtajcie - najwa≈ºniejsze jest to, ≈ºeby m√≥wiƒá z sercem. Wasza mi≈Ço≈õƒá sprawi, ≈ºe nawet niedoskona≈Ça wymowa bƒôdzie brzmia≈Ça piƒôknie.
